metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14354 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A possible use-after-free and double-free in c-ares lib version 1.16.0 if ares_destroy() is called prior to ares_getaddrinfo() completing. This flaw possibly allows an attacker to crash the service that uses c-ares lib. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to this service availability.

criterions.comment: c-ares: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
